info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 29 at 3:55PM AST until April 29 at 7:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
info.description:
At 355 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Due to frequent water surges along Rio Orocovis, local emergency managers ordered evacuations of Barrio Pueblo. In Barranquitas, emergency managers urge citizens to remain alert. Report any flood-related impacts to the local authorities or calling 9 1 1.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Orocovis and Barranquitas.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AST THIS EVENING FOR BARRANQUITAS AND OROCOVIS COUNTIES
NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 7:00 PM AST. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 7:00 PM AST. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AST THIS EVENING FOR BARRANQUITAS AND OROCOVIS COUNTIES
SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 7:00 PM AST. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 7:00 PM AST. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
